Relational Databases.quote: Structured data in tables with relationships: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server. ACID compliant with SQL querying.

NoSQL Databases.quote: Non-relational databases: MongoDB (Document), Cassandra (Column), Neo4j (Graph), Redis (Key-Value).

File Systems.quote: Direct file storage: Local disks, Network File Systems (NFS), Distributed File Systems (HDFS).

APIs.quote: Web Services: REST APIs, GraphQL, SOAP, WebSocket for real-time data streaming.

Streaming Data.quote: Real-time data flows: Apache Kafka, Amazon Kinesis, RabbitMQ, Apache Pulsar.

Data Warehouses.quote: Enterprise storage: Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, Teradata.

Data Lakes.quote: Raw data storage: Amazon S3, Azure Data Lake, Google Cloud Storage.

Time Series Databases.quote: Temporal data: InfluxDB, TimescaleDB, Prometheus for metrics and monitoring.

Search Engines.quote: Text and analytics: Elasticsearch, Solr, Algolia for full-text search and analytics.

Cache Systems.quote: Fast access storage: Redis, Memcached, Hazelcast for performance optimization.

Message Queues.quote: Asynchronous communication: RabbitMQ, Apache ActiveMQ, Amazon SQS.

Blockchain.quote: Distributed ledgers: Ethereum, Hyperledger, Bitcoin networks for immutable records.

Cloud Storage.quote: Remote storage services: AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage.

Document Stores.quote: Semi-structured data: MongoDB, Couchbase, Amazon DocumentDB.

Graph Databases.quote: Relationship-focused: Neo4j, Amazon Neptune, ArangoDB for connected data.

Columnar Stores.quote: Column-oriented: Apache Cassandra, Apache HBase, Amazon Redshift.

Vector Databases.quote: Similarity search: Milvus, Pinecone, Weaviate for ML embeddings.

In-Memory Databases.quote: RAM-based storage: Redis, Apache Ignite, Memcached for speed.

Data Marts.quote: Subject-specific: Departmental databases, specialized analytical stores.

Flat Files.quote: Simple storage: CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, ORC file formats.

Web Scraping.quote: Internet data: HTML parsing, web crawlers, browser automation tools.

IoT Devices.quote: Sensor data: MQTT protocols, IoT hubs, edge computing devices.

Event Stores.quote: Event sourcing: EventStoreDB, Apache Kafka for event logging.

Data Feeds.quote: Continuous updates: RSS feeds, news APIs, social media streams.

Legacy Systems.quote: Historical sources: Mainframes, COBOL databases, older file formats.

Open Data.quote: Public datasets: Government portals, research repositories, public APIs.

Spatial Databases.quote: Geographic data: PostGIS, MongoDB Geospatial, Oracle Spatial.

Data Services.quote: Third-party providers: Weather services, financial data, market feeds.

Archive Systems.quote: Long-term storage: Tape drives, cold storage, compliance archives.
